newsitem.title: USA: Nebraska fed cattle market quiet, no trade - USDA.
newsitem.headline: Nebraska fed cattle market quiet, no trade - USDA.

text.p: Trading on slaughter steers and heifers was quiet Friday following large weekly movement of 109,000, USDA said.

Some buyer inquiry evident, but selling side has already completed their week's work and showlists pretty well depleted. Despite the sessions large sales volume, trade members continue to expect ample available supplies through the coming weeks.
Live basis sales - Equivalent 3 percent shrink delivered and FOB, some FOB 4% shrink. Dressed basis delivered ( paid on hot carcass weights)
Sales confirmed - None. For the week - None.
